definition: flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)
erhua variant of 麵條|面条[mian4 tiao2]

sentences.english: Eringi Cream White Sauce Spaghetti with minced meat.
sentences.chinese: 杏鲍菇肉末忌廉白汁意面条。

sentences.english: I would rather have noodles than rice.
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿吃面条也不吃米饭。

sentences.english: At supper she had two huge plates full of lasagna.
sentences.chinese: 晚饭时她吃了两大碗满满当当的肉酱宽面条。

sentences.english: Serve the sauce over fresh tagliatelle.
sentences.chinese: 将肉酱倒在新鲜面条上。
那也别忘了推着小车卖面条。

sentences.english: Do you like rice or noodles?
Noodles in China have a long history.
sentences.chinese: 面条在中国拥有悠久的历史。

sentences.english: It is usually served with rice or with noodles.
sentences.chinese: 肉骨茶通常用来搭配米饭或面条。

sentences.english: We are noodle folk. Broth runs through our veins.
sentences.chinese: 我们是做面条的，血脉里流淌着汤汁。

sentences.english: We just eat noodles or buns.
It's not a food of mass consumption, like noodles or rice.
sentences.chinese: 这可不像面条或大米一样，是大众能消费的食物。

sentences.english: Dim lights flickered above the noodle stalls.
sentences.chinese: 昏暗的光在面条摊上忽闪着。

sentences.english: Slurping noodles is not entirely for the sake of politeness, but also to avoid having a burnt tongue.
sentences.chinese: 吸溜面条不但是为礼貌，而且还为了避免烫伤舌头。

sentences.english: A touch extra virgin olive oil around Bolognese and pasta.
sentences.chinese: 在肉酱和面条上撒些初榨橄榄油。

sentences.english: Yes, madam. Mat I suggest the noodle soup with shrimps?
sentences.chinese: 好的，夫人，您的面条配虾汤好吗？

sentences.english: She put some noodles in the aluminum saucepan.
sentences.chinese: 她在铝锅里下了些面条。

definition: vermicelli made from mung bean starch etc
erhua variant of 麵條|面条[mian4 tiao2]
(dialect) minced or diced meat (as part of a dish)
noodles served with soy sauce/sesame butter etc
